metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2914 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
fish (aka fish-shell) 2.0.0 before 2.1.1 does not restrict access to the configuration service (aka fish_config), which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors, as demonstrated by set_prompt.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2914` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fish - 2.1.1-1
fish-common - 2.1.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fish package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
